quote: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
Our passion and principals are constantly in a frenzy, but begin to shift and waver, as we return to reason.
Passion for fame: A passion which is the instinct of all great souls.
Passion makes idiots of the cleverest men, and makes the biggest idiots clever.
A frenzied passion for art is a canker that devours everything else.
A man in passion rides a horse that runs away with him.
A populace never rebels from passion for attack, but from impatience of suffering.
A strong passion for any object will ensure success, for the desire of the end will point out the means.
Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
Our passion and principals are constantly in a frenzy, but begin to shift and waver, as we return to reason.
Passion for fame: A passion which is the instinct of all great souls.
Passion makes idiots of the cleverest men, and makes the biggest idiots clever.
A frenzied passion for art is a canker that devours everything else.
A man in passion rides a horse that runs away with him.
A populace never rebels from passion for attack, but from impatience of suffering.
A strong passion for any object will ensure success, for the desire of the end will point out the means.
A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
Act nothing in a furious passion. It's putting to sea in a storm.
All humanity is passion; without passion, religion, history, novels, art would be ineffectual.
Ambition is so powerful a passion in the human breast, that however high we reach we are never satisfied.
Anger is a momentary madness, so control your passion or it will control you.
As iron is eaten away by rust, so the envious are consumed by their own passion.
As reason is a rebel to faith, so passion is a rebel to reason.
Ask with urgency and passion.
Be still when you have nothing to say: when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.
Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.
Chase your passion, not your pension.
Curiosity is, in great and generous minds, the first passion and the last.
Develop a passion for learning. If you do, you will never cease to grow.
Dispassionate objectivity is itself a passion, for the real and for the truth.
Each person, makes their own terrible passion their God.
Every man without passion has within him no principle of action, nor motive of act.
Every passion borders on the chaotic, but the collector's passion borders on the chaos of memories.
Faith is the highest passion in a human being. Many in every generation may not come that far, but none comes further.
Great dancers are not great because of their technique; they are great because of their passion.
He only employs his passion who can make no use of his reason.
He who has no passion has no principal or motive to act.
Honest criticism means nothing: what one wants is unrestrained passion, fire for fire.
How can sincerity be a condition of friendship? A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
I have no respect for the passion of equality, which seems to me merely idealizing envy.
I want to know what passion is. I want to feel something strongly.
If O.J. had been accused of killing his black wife, you would not have seen the same passion stirred up.
If passion drives you, let reason hold the reins.
If we seek the pleasures of love, passion should be occasional, and common sense continual.
If you have a great passion it seems that the logical thing is to see the fruit of it, and the fruit are children.
In her first passion, a woman loves her lover, in all the others all she loves is love.
Indulge not thyself in the passion of anger; it is whetting a sword to wound thine own breast, or murder thy friend.
It is difficult to lay aside a confirmed passion.
It is foolish to pretend that one is fully recovered from a disappointed passion. Such wounds always leave a scar.
It is the passion that is in a kiss that gives to it its sweetness; it is the affection in a kiss that sanctifies it.
Lust's passion will be served; it demands, it militates, it tyrannizes.
Man is a useless passion.
Men live by intervals of reason under the sovereignty of humor and passion.
Moral passion without entertainment is propaganda, and entertainment without moral passion is television.
No passion so effectually robs the mind of all its powers of acting and reasoning as fear.
None, but people of strong passion are capable of rising to greatness.
auther: Honoré Gabriel Riqueti Count of Mirabeau

quote: Nothing fools people as much as extreme passion.
On life's vast ocean diversely we sail. Reasons the card, but passion the gale.
Our doubt is our passion, and our passion is our task.
Our passion are the true phoenixes; when the old one is burnt out, a new one rises from its ashes.
Passion and prejudice govern the world; only under the name of reason.
Passion doesn't look beyond the moment of its existence.
Passion is momentary; love is enduring.
Passion is the drunkenness of the mind.
Passion is the genesis of genius.
Passion is the mob of the man, that commits a riot upon his reason.
Passion is universal humanity. Without it religion, history, romance and art would be useless.
Passion makes the best observations and the sorriest conclusions.
Passion, though a bad regulator, is a powerful spring.
Patience is passion tamed.
Perhaps misguided moral passion is better than confused indifference.
Reason guides but a small part of man, and the rest obeys feeling, true or false, and passion, good or bad.
Reason over passion.
Revenge is the act of passion, vengeance is an act of justice.
Sacrifice, which is the passion of great souls, has never been the law of societies.
Since obscenity is the truth of our passion today, it is the only stuff of art - or almost the only stuff.
Skill is the unified force of experience, intellect and passion in their operation.
Strength instead of being the lusty child of passion, grows by grappling with and subduing them.
Strength of mind rests in sobriety; for this keeps your reason unclouded by passion.
Subdue your passion or it will subdue you.
Sudden glory is the passion which makes those grimaces called laughter.
Temperance is simply a disposition of the mind which binds the passion.
Tenderness is the rest of passion.
That which is to be loved long must be loved with reason rather than with passion.
The duration of passion is proportionate with the original resistance of the woman.
The essence of poetry is will and passion.
The feeling of gratitude has all the ardor of a passion in noble hearts.
The first step to boosting your income is to identify where your passion lives and to be true to it.
The law is reason, free from passion.
The mind profits by the wrecks of every passion.
The mind's passion is all for singling out. Obscurity has another tale to tell.
The only difference between a caprice and a life-long passion is that the caprice lasts a little longer.
The only sin passion can commit is to be joyless.
The passion for destruction is also a creative passion.
The presence of passion within you is the greatest gift you can receive. Treat it as a miracle.
The profoundest thought or passion sleeps as in a mine, until an equal mind and heart finds and publishes it.
The real passion of the twentieth century is servitude.
The ruling passion, be it what it will, The ruling passion conquers reason still.
The secret of successful speakers? Passion and compassion with a purpose.
The selfish spirit of commerce, which knows no country, and feels no passion or principle but that of gain.
There is a passion for hunting something deeply implanted in the human breast.
There is no nation so powerful, as the one that obeys its laws not from principals of fear or reason, but from passion.
There is no passion so contagious as that of fear.
There is only one passion, the passion for happiness.
Unions in wedlock are perverted by the victory of shameless passion that masters the female among men and beasts.
We may affirm absolutely that nothing great in the world has ever been accomplished without passion.
We must act out passion before we can feel it.
We must select the Illusion which appeals to our temperament and embrace it with passion, if we want to be happy.
What our age lacks is not reflection, but passion.
What passion cannot Music raise and quell?
With me poetry has not been a purpose, but a passion.
With me poetry has not been a purpose, but a passion.
Woman often feigns love; man, oftener, passion.
Youth is ever apt to judge in haste,
He submits to be seen through a microscope, who suffers himself to be caught in a fit of passion.
We are never like angels till our passion dies.
